snippet.title: Apple's iPad slump is over
snippet.content:
Apple's iPad business is growing again.
After , the iPad business saw a boost last quarter, according to .
Apple sold 11.4 million iPads in the quarter, up from 9.95 million in the year-ago quarter. (That's 14% growth in unit sales.)
That could be due to the new 10.5-inch iPad Pro, which launched last month to . Apple also released a new version of the 9.7-inch iPad, which starts at a much lower price, $US329. That likely drove a lot of sales.
The iPad is also scheduled to get a , which will add more desktop-like features to the iPad.
